heading: Deaths
txt: Alexander Lippisch, German pilot and engineer (b. 1894)

heading: Deaths
txt: Fakhruddin Ali Ahmed, Indian lawyer and politician, President of India (b. 1905)

entities.title: Fakhruddin Ali Ahmed
entities.description: Fakhruddin Ali Ahmed was an Indian lawyer and politician who served as the fifth President of India from 1974 to 1977. He was also the second President of India to die in office.

entities.title: President of India
entities.description: The President of India, officially the President of the Republic of India, is the ceremonial head of state of India and the commander-in-chief of the Indian Armed Forces. Ram Nath Kovind is the 14th and current president.

heading: Deaths
txt: Louis Beel, Dutch academic and politician, Prime Minister of the Netherlands (b. 1902)

entities.title: Prime Minister of the Netherlands
entities.description: The prime minister of the Netherlands is the head of the executive branch of the Government of the Netherlands. The prime minister is the chair of the Council of Ministers and coordinates its policy with his cabinet. The current acting prime minister is Mark Rutte, who serves in a demissionary capacity after his resignation on 15 January 2021.

heading: Deaths
txt: James Bryant Conant, American chemist and academic (b. 1893)

entities.title: James Bryant Conant
entities.description: James Bryant Conant was an American chemist, a transformative President of Harvard University, and the first U.S. Ambassador to West Germany. Conant obtained a Ph.D. in Chemistry from Harvard in 1916. During World War I he served in the U.S. Army, working on the development of poison gases, especially Lewisite. He became an assistant professor of chemistry at Harvard in 1919 and the Sheldon Emery

heading: Deaths
txt: Harry Martinson, Swedish novelist, essayist, and poet, Nobel Prize laureate (b. 1904)

entities.title: Nobel Prize in Literature
entities.description: The Nobel Prize in Literature is a Swedish literature prize that is awarded annually, since 1901, to an author from any country who has, in the words of the will of Swedish industrialist Alfred Nobel, "in the field of literature, produced the most outstanding work in an idealistic direction". Though individual works are sometimes cited as being particularly noteworthy, the award is based on an aut

heading: Deaths
txt: Eleanor Powell, American actress and dancer (b. 1912)

entities.title: Eleanor Powell
entities.description: Eleanor Torrey Powell was an American dancer and actress. Best remembered for her tap dance numbers in musical films in the 1930s and 1940s, Powell began studying ballet when she was six and was dancing at nightclubs in Atlantic City before she was a teenager. heading: Deaths
txt: Henry Hathaway, American actor, director, and producer (b. 1898)

entities.title: Henry Hathaway
entities.description: Henry Hathaway was an American film director and producer. He is best known as a director of Westerns, especially starring Randolph Scott and John Wayne. He directed Gary Cooper in seven films.

heading: Deaths
txt: Frank Herbert, American journalist and author (b. 1920)

entities.title: Frank Herbert
entities.description: Franklin Patrick Herbert Jr. was an American science fiction author best known for the 1965 novel Dune and its five sequels. Though he became famous for his novels, he also wrote short stories and worked as a newspaper journalist, photographer, book reviewer, ecological consultant, and lecturer.

heading: Deaths
txt: George O'Hanlon, American actor and voice artist (b. 1912)

entities.title: George O'Hanlon
entities.description: George Samuel O'Hanlon was an American actor and writer. He was best known for his role as Joe McDoakes in the Warner Bros.' live-action Joe McDoakes short subjects from 1942 to 1956 and as the voice of George Jetson in Hanna-Barbera's 1962 prime-time animated television series The Jetsons and its 1985 revival.

heading: Deaths
txt: Robert W. Holley, American biochemist and academic, Nobel Prize laureate (b. 1922)

entities.title: Robert W. Holley
entities.description: Robert William Holley was an American biochemist. He shared the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1968 for describing the structure of alanine transfer RNA, linking DNA and protein synthesis.

entities.title: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine
entities.description: The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine is awarded yearly by the Nobel Assembly at the Karolinska Institutet for outstanding discoveries in physiology or medicine.

heading: Deaths
txt: Neil Bonnett, American race car driver (b. 1946)

entities.title: Neil Bonnett
entities.description: Lawrence Neil Bonnett was an American NASCAR driver who compiled 18 victories and 20 poles over his 18-year career. Bonnett was a member of the Alabama Gang, and started his career with the help of Bobby and Donnie Allison. She was the daughter of Marion Catherine Cave, an English political activist, and Carlo Rosselli, who was a hero of the Italian anti-Fascist Resistance—founder, with his brother Nello, of the liberal socialist movement "Justice and Liberty."

entities.description: Aldwyn Roberts HBM DA, better known by the stage name Lord Kitchener, was a Trinbagonian calypsonian. He has been described as "the grand master of calypso" and "the greatest calypsonian of the post-war age".

entities.title: Shirley Strickland
entities.description: Shirley Barbara de la Hunty AO, MBE, known as Shirley Strickland during her early career, was an Australian athlete. She won more Olympic medals than any other Australian in running sports.

heading: Deaths
txt: Jack L. Chalker, American author (b. 1944)

entities.title: Jack L. Chalker
entities.description: Jack Laurence Chalker was an American science fiction author. Chalker was also a Baltimore City Schools history teacher in Maryland for 12 years, retiring during 1978 to write full-time. He also was a member of the Washington Science Fiction Association and was involved in the founding of the Baltimore Science Fiction Society.

entities.title: Peter Benchley
entities.description: Peter Bradford Benchley was an American author, screenwriter, and ocean activist. He is known as the author of the bestselling novel Jaws and co-wrote its film adaptation with Carl Gottlieb. Several more of his works were also adapted for both cinema and television, including The Deep, The Island, Beast, and White Shark.

heading: Deaths
txt: Chuck Tanner, American baseball player and manager (b. 1928)

entities.title: Chuck Tanner
entities.description: Charles William Tanner was an American professional baseball player and manager. He played as a left fielder in Major League Baseball. He was known for his unwavering confidence and infectious optimism. He managed the Pittsburgh Pirates to a World Series championship in 1979. He last served as a senior adviser to Pirates general manager Neal Huntington.
